natural problem: For any number $x$, we are told that $x\&=7-x$ and $\&x = x -7$. What is the value of $\&(12\&)$?

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. g x = 7 - x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g (g x) = x - 7"
shows  "g (g 12) = -12"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 For any number $x$, we are told that $x\&=7-x$ and $\&x = x -7$. What is the value of $\&(12\&)$? The final Answer is -12
 ### Proof
 We have $\&(12\&)=\&(7-12)=\&(-5)=(-5-7)=\boxed{-12}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. g x = 7 - x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g (g x) = x - 7"
shows  "g (g 12) = -12"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Define a function $g(x) = 7 - x$. What is the value of $g(g(12))$? The final answer is $-12$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and amp :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. amp x = 7 - x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. amp amp x = x - 7"
shows  "amp amp 12 = -12"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 For any number $x$, we are told that $x\&=7-x$ and $\&x = x -7$. What is the value of $\&(12\&)$? The final Answer is -12
 ### Proof
 We have $\&(12\&)=\&(7-12)=\&(-5)=(-5-7)=\boxed{-12}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and amp :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. amp x = 7 - x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. amp amp x = x - 7"
shows  "amp amp 12 = -12"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: If a function $amp(x)$ is defined as $7 - x$ and $amp(amp(x))$ is defined as $x - 7$, what is the value of $amp(amp(12))$? The final answer is $-12$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. x & = 7 - x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. & x = x - 7"
shows  "& (12 &) = -12"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 For any number $x$, we are told that $x\&=7-x$ and $\&x = x -7$. What is the value of $\&(12\&)$? The final Answer is -12
 ### Proof
 We have $\&(12\&)=\&(7-12)=\&(-5)=(-5-7)=\boxed{-12}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. x & = 7 - x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. & x = x - 7"
shows  "& (12 &) = -12"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given that the operation & is defined such that for all real numbers x, x & equals 7 - x, and & x equals x - 7, find the value of & (12 &). The final answer is -12.
